intro: Cremanthodium latilobum, commonly known as the broad-lipped cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
